newsitem.title: LEBANON: Israeli forces kill Lebanese civilian.
newsitem.headline: Israeli forces kill Lebanese civilian.

text.p: Israeli forces killed a 70-year old Lebanese civilian in south Lebanon early on Saturday, U.N. peacekeepers said.

An Israeli tank fired one round of anti-personnel shells at the village of Adsheet Al-Kosseir inside Israel's south Lebanon occupation zone, an officer with the U.N. Interim Forces In Lebanon (UNIFIL) told Reuters.
Ahmed Sayyed Swaidan, picking up vegetation for his animals near his house inside the village, was killed immediately, the officer added.
Israel said on Saturday it "unintentionally" shot and killed a Lebanese civilian overnight in south Lebanon.

"A Lebanese citizen was unintentionally killed by Israeli army gunfire as he walked in a suspicious area late at night...known to be a location where there are only terrorists," an Israel army spokeswoman said.

"An initial investigation carried out by the unit commander showed that the unit followed operational procedures and did not veer from its orders," she said, adding "the army expresses regret over the incident."
Israel holds a 15-km (nine mile)-wide border zone in south Lebanon. Pro-Iranian Hizbollah guerrillas have been fighting to oust the Israeli troops and their local militia allies from the area.
A U.S. brokered ceasefire understanding that ended a 17-year Israeli onslaught on Lebanon in April 1996 bars the targeting of civilian areas by Israeli forces or Hizbollah.
